com.faunadb.client

Class FaunaClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.faunadb.client.FaunaClient

  • public class FaunaClient
extends java.lang.Object
    The Java native client for FaunaDB.

    This client is asynchronous, so all methods that perform latent operations return a CompletableFuture.

    Queries are constructed by using the static helpers in the Language package.

    Example: 

    
 import static com.faunadb.client.query.Language.*;
 FaunaClient client = FaunaClient.builder().withSecret("someAuthToken").build();
 client.query(Get(Ref(Class("some_class"), "ref")));
    See Also:
    Language

    • Method Detail

      • builder

        public static FaunaClient.Builder builder()
        Creates a new FaunaClient.Builder
        Returns:
        a new FaunaClient.Builder

      • newSessionClient

        public FaunaClient newSessionClient(java.lang.String secret)
        Creates a session client with the user secret provided. Queries submited to a session client will be authenticated with the secret provided.
        Parameters:
        secret - user secret for the session client
        Returns:
        a new FaunaClient

      • close

        public void close()
        Frees any resources held by the client. Also closes the underlying OkHttpClient.

      • query

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<Value> query(Expr expr)
        Issues a Query to FaunaDB.

        Queries are modeled through the FaunaDB query language, represented by the helper functions in the Language class.

        Responses are modeled as a general response tree. Each node is a Value, and can be converted to structured types through various methods on that class.

        Parameters:
        expr - The query expression to be sent to FaunaDB.
        Returns:
        A CompletableFuture containing the root node of the Response tree.
        See Also:
        Value, Language

      • query

        public java.util.concurrent.CompletableFuture<java.util.List<Value>> query(java.util.List<? extends Expr> exprs)
        Issues multiple queries to FaunaDB.

        These queries are sent to FaunaDB in a single request, and are evaluated. The list of response nodes is returned in the same order as the issued queries.

        See query(Expr) for more information on the individual queries.

        Parameters:
        exprs - the list of query expressions to be sent to FaunaDB.
        Returns:
        a CompletableFuture containing an ordered list of root response nodes.
